paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a TTR gene variant associated with familial transthyretin-associated amyloidosis.

patients.phenotype: familial transthyretin-associated amyloidosis with bilateral vitreous opacities

individual_records.phenotype_details: bilateral vitreous opacities and recurrence of ocular amyloid
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 35-year-old man with autosomal-dominant, familial transthyretin-associated amyloidosis and bilateral vitreous opacities had a recurrence of amyloidosis following vitrectomy.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to the production of an abnormal protein, which deposits extracellularly in the form of amyloid fibrils.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with familial amyloidosis as evidenced by family history.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a family history of amyloidosis in the father and paternal grandmother.
key_quotes: A transthoracic echocardiogram was performed, which showed a thickened ventricular septum, suggestive of an infiltrative cardiomyopathy.
An abdominal fat aspirate was positive for amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
